Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
feat!(app-webpack): remove Vuex support (backport from app-vite)

[Pinia](https://pinia.vuejs.org/) has been the official store for Vue 3 for a while now. Vuex was deprecated in app-webpack v3 and it had problems with the new structure, so it's now removed.
You can still use Vuex as any Vue plugin, but you will have to manage everything(installing the store, hydration, no `store` parameter in boot files, etc.) yourself and will not receive any support from Quasar CLI. You will likely have to patch Vuex in order to get it working with TypeScript.
We recommend migrating to Pinia.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
feat!(app-vite): remove Vuex support

[Pinia](https://pinia.vuejs.org/) has been the official store for Vue 3 for a while now. Vuex was deprecated in app-vite v1 and it had problems with the new structure, so it's now removed.
You can still use Vuex as any Vue plugin, but you will have to manage everything(installing the store, hydration, no `store` parameter in boot files, etc.) yourself and will not receive any support from Quasar CLI. You will likely have to patch Vuex in order to get it working with TypeScript.
We recommend migrating to Pinia.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
feat!(app-vite): auto generate base tsconfig and types (#17549)

* feat(app-vite): generate .quasar/tsconfig.json

* feat(app-vite): generate tsconfig exclude

* feat(app-vite): add Capacitor dependencies to tsconfig paths
the Vite aliases were already there, thanks to this, TypeScript won't
complain about using Capacitor deps inside src/ anymore

* feat(app-vite): handle folder module and file aliases in tsconfig paths

* refactor(app-vite): extract tsconfig generation to a function

* feat(app-vite): generate nested path aliases for capacitor deps too
e.g. `@capacitor/dep/deep/import`

* feat(app-vite): add build.typescript.extendTsConfig hook

* feat(app-vite): create a better tsconfig, drop presets
enforce TS >=5.4 to use module: 'preserve'
forceConsistentCasingInFileNames defaults to true since TS 5.0
verbatimModuleSyntax will require user to update their codes
jsx: preserve is no longer needed for Vue Language Tools

strict: true and some of the other strict options will be added through a flag

* feat(app-vite): add an option to generate tsconfig with strict rules

compared to previous regular preset:
noUnusedLocals is turned off as it produces extra noise when using ESLint, where the behavior is better as it's configurable

compared to previous stricter config:
noPropertyAccessFromIndexSignature is removed as it doesn't even allow process.env.DEV unless it's augmented explicitly, which we don't do at the moment. It enforces process.env['DEV'] instead, which is annoying and confusing to use. We can't augment the env variables as Node types enforce string, but our own types are actual boolean values.

noImplicitReturns reduces the DX and is not that beneficial in app code compared to its use in library code. It still has it's uses, but it doesn't belong the usual strictness.

* feat(app-vite): only generate .quasar/tsconfig.json if the app has TS

* fix(app-vite): correctly handle non-existent aliases
they were throwing errors, now we skip them for an even slimmer result

* feat(create-quasar): adapt ts-vite-2  to latest specs

* fix(app-vite): suppress the esbuild tsconfig.json warning
when .quasar/tsconfig.json is missing prior to generation

* feat(app-vite): split types generation, handle it on diff
now it will re-generate the types if build.typescript or build.alias gets updated

* feat(app-vite): add prepare command
to generate tsconfig and types

* feat(create-quasar): add postinstall script to run quasar prepare

* feat(create-quasar): remove tsconfig.vue-tsc.json as it's not required anymore

* feat(app-vite): move feature flags into .quasar

* feat(create-quasar): remove unused store-flag.d.ts
as feature flags are handled into .quasar now

* docs(app-vite): document tsconfig changes

* feat(app-vite): generate declarations and vue shims

* feat(app-vite): make vue shim generation optional

* feat(create-quasar): adapt to latest TS specs

* docs(app-vite): document dts generation and feature flag changes

* docs(app-vite): correctly reference .quasar/tsconfig

* docs(app-vite): mention Capacitor TS changes

* refactor(app-vite): queue generateTypes call instead of awaiting

* docs(app-vite): enrich TS-related info in upgrade guide

* Update bex-devserver.js

* Update app-devserver.js

* Update mode.js

* feat(app-vite): generate and utilize tsconfig for JS projects too

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

---------

Author: Calson Chiatiah
Message:
test(QSelect): explicitly ensure elements are visible before clicking (#16970)

test(QSelect): explicity check for visibility before clicking

- The QSelect random failure is caused by clicking on an element when it is not yet visible. Even though cypress is supposed to check that an element is visible before clicking, sometimes due to race conditions or for some other reason, the element may be found and clicked when it is not yet visible. So "should('be.visible')" has been explicitly added to ensure tests are much more deterministic

Author: Haoqun Jiang
Message:
fix: migrate ecosystem-ci scripts to pnpm (#17003)

There's no `pnpm workspace` command. Instead, pnpm uses the `--filter`
option to run a command in a specific workspace.

Note there will always be a "ELIFECYCLE Command failed." message at the
end of the vite-plugin test.
But that's from the vite preview server being stopped after a successful
test run. It's not a real error and doesn't affect the test result or
the exit code.

Author: Matt-Kaminski
Message:
fix(QColor): slider triggers "Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded" in onHueChange (fix #16999) (#17001)

Fix for "Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded #16999

While interacting with a color picker component using a slider, an unhandled "Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded" error occurs within the onHueChange event handler, indicating the presence of a straightforward infinite loop.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
chore: migrate the monorepo to pnpm (#16990)

* chore: migrate to pnpm

* feat(app-vite&app-webpack): improve package manager references in banners

* chore: remove npm reference in dev app uploader page

* docs: upgrade contribution guide

* chore: correctly include extras in workspaces

* chore: include create-quasar in workspaces

* chore: centralize .editorconfig

* chore: remove yarn.lock

* chore: only allow pnpm

* chore: centralize linting packages and config

* chore: create shared eslint config package

* chore: remove redundant pnpm.peerDependencyRules.ignoreMissing
it needs to be specified in the root since we are using pnpm workspaces
but, it doesn't seem to be changing any behavior, so it's redundant

* chore: include cli in workspaces

* ci: ensure pnpm is installed and cache is set correctly

* chore: generate pnpm lock file after rebase

* chore: tidy up eslintignore

* chore: setup root lint script

* chore: include app-webpack in workspaces

* chore: update vscode config

* chore: update .github/CONTRIBUTING.md

* chore: regenerate lock file

* ci: fix create test project script
after migrating to pnpm workspaces, some behavior got changed
1. prompts package named imports are not working. This is probably due to switching to a different version during migration, rather than a pnpm specific issue.
2. When using pnpm to create the test project, it becomes part of the monorepo, which makes it fail to install properly.

* ci: fix weird test creation test issue with yarn

* Revert "ci: fix weird test creation test issue with yarn"

This reverts commit 5fcaa12ae1caf22ee7906048dc3ee9755dda1b4a.

* ci: fix weird test creation test issue with yarn
https://github.com/yarnpkg/yarn/issues/9015

* ci: apply skip yarn corepack check to other scripts as well
but still keep it in create-test-project script to avoid the problem when executing the script in different environments

* ci: cache Cypress binary to fix tests on pr workflow

* ci: install Cypress binary when cache does not exit
and correctly cache it

* chore(ui): fix tests not being able to run

Author: Calson Chiatiah
Message:
test(QDialog): add QDialog tests (#16636)

* test(QDialog): add QDialog tests

* test(QDialog): improve test stability

* test(use-model-toggle): improve test stability

* test(QDialog): refactor and fix some tests

* test(QDialog): refactor and improve tests

* chore(ui) upgrade test deps

* test(QDialog): refactor some tests to be more readable

* test(use-model-toggle): revert changes on use-model-toggle and prefer stopping animation on QMenu to fix event issues

- After a dialog has been closed, the hide event is fired only after the duration transitionDuration has elapsed. transitionDuration is a prop passed to use-model-toggle.js and has a default value of 300ms. Hence, we cannot depend on the dialog closing to conclude that the event has been fired. Setting transitionDuration to 0 ensures it fires immediately

* test(use-model-toggle): add test for 'hide' event interaction with transition duration prop

* test(QDialog): apply vModelAdapter fix

---------

Co-authored-by: Paolo Caleffi <p.caleffi@dreamonkey.com>

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
fix(docs): improve a11y of back to top button
q-tooltip is meant for general clarity, including accessible users.
It's not for screen readers.
If q-tooltip always stayed in the DOM, we could've used aria-describedby
and connect the button with the tooltip and should not need aria-label.
But, it gets dynamically created when needed, so we can't rely on
aria-describedby to explain the button

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
fix(docs): improve a11y of footer with role="list"

QList used to have role="list" by default, added with #14609. 
But, it was later removed with #14784 since it's also used with the menu role commonly.
So, now QItems have role="listitem" but their parent(QList) doesn't have the list role, which is invalid.

* BEX entry points tweaks

Author: Dan Rose
Message:
fix(cli/icongenie/ssr-error): convert file URL to path correctly for Windows (#16154)

* Convert file: URL to path correctly
This fixes various path issues on Windows. Most notably a crash when loading quasar.config:
> ERR_UNSUPPORTED_ESM_URL_SCHEME]: Only URLs with a scheme in: file, data, and node are supported by the default ESM loader. On Windows, absolute paths must be valid file:// URLs. Received protocol 'c:'

The node function [url.fileURLToPath](https://nodejs.org/api/url.html#urlfileurltopathurl) correctly performs this translation.

* remove semicolon

* semicolon

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat(app-webpack): env dotfiles support #15303

Order matters!

.env                                # loaded in all cases
.env.local                          # loaded in all cases, ignored by git
.env.[dev|prod]                     # loaded for dev or prod only
.env.local.[dev|prod]               # loaded for dev or prod only, ignored by git
.env.[quasarMode]                   # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode only
.env.local.[quasarMode]             # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode only, ignored by git
.env.[dev|prod].[quasarMode]        # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode and dev|prod only
.env.local.[dev|prod].[quasarMode]  # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode and dev|prod only, ignored by git

Also, new quasar.config file props:

/**
* Folder where Quasar CLI should look for .env* files.
* Can be an absolute path or a relative path to project root directory.
*
* @default project root directory
*/
envFolder?: string;
/**
* Additional .env* files to be loaded.
* Each entry can be an absolute path or a relative path to quasar.config > build > envFolder.
*
* @example ['.env.somefile', '../.env.someotherfile']
*/
envFiles?: string[];

Message:

.env.local.[quasarMode]             # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode only, ignored by git
.env.[dev|prod].[quasarMode]        # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode and dev|prod only
.env.local.[dev|prod].[quasarMode]  # loaded for specific Quasar CLI mode and dev|prod only, ignored by git

Author: Dan Rose
Message:
Update vs-code-configuration.md (#15802)

* Update vs-code-configuration.md

Improve developer experience by setting `"enableContentValidation": false`. Without this, when Vite reloads a module with HMR and a .js file is referencing another .js file via a relative import, VSCode will open the script in a new read-only window.

Switch to jsonc since comments are allowed in launch.json

---------

Author: Custom Automated Systems Pte Ltd
Message:
fix(render-ssr-error): Removed pathname from URL in readFileSync and changed replaceAll to replace (#15811)

This was not working in node 14 on Windows. Believe that readFileSync works with the URLs without using pathname - using pathname causes an ENOENT. For replaceAll, there's no need to use it as the regex contains /g, using replace is good enough and works with node 14.

Author: Mark Lansky
Message:
feat(app-vite): support quasar.config.cjs (#15756)

* feat: support quasar.conf(ig).cjs

#9455
I would like to use Quasar with `"type": "module"` in my `package.json`.

Without converting file to `cjs` I get an error from Node:
```
Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: require() of ES Module /Users/zerdox/p/cryp/table-cups/quasar.config.js from /Users/zerdox/p/cryp/table-cups/node_modules/@quasar/app-vite/lib/quasar-config-file.js not supported.
quasar.config.js is treated as an ES module file as it is a .js file whose nearest parent package.json contains "type": "module" which declares all .js files in that package scope as ES modules.
Instead rename quasar.config.js to end in .cjs, change the requiring code to use dynamic import() which is available in all CommonJS modules, or change "type": "module" to "type": "commonjs" in /Users/zerdox/p/cryp/table-cups/package.json to treat all .js files as CommonJS (using .mjs for all ES modules instead).

    at QuasarConfFile.read (/Users/zerdox/p/cryp/table-cups/node_modules/@quasar/app-vite/lib/quasar-config-file.js:204:30)
    at build (/Users/zerdox/p/cryp/table-cups/node_modules/@quasar/app-vite/lib/cmd/build.js:134:43) {
  code: 'ERR_REQUIRE_ESM'
}

 App • ⚠️   FAIL  quasar.config.js has JS errors
```

Please let me stick with ESM :)

Author: Jay McGuinness
Message:
feat(docs): Transitions page -> Make individual transition images clickable (#15048)

Make individual transition images clickable

Everytime I visit the Transitions docs (https://quasar.dev/options/transitions#introduction) and want to choose a transition I can only trigger them all at the same time, which makes my brain hurt.

This PR makes the individual images clickable so it's easier to see how each type of transition works.

Author: Roman Obuhov
Message:
fix(ui): Localization file for Kazakh renamed (no issue in github) (#14985)

Rename localization file(s) for Kazakh.
Locale in file name must be "kk", not "kz",
more details about it can be found in discussion https://github.com/quasarframework/quasar/discussions/12663

BREAKING CHANGE:
This change will break all dependencies to "ui/lang/kz.js" and "ui/lang/kz.mjs"

Message:
feat(docs): Update routing.md (#14658)

Vue router documentation uses 'requiresAuth' instead of 'requireAuth'
(https://router.vuejs.org/guide/advanced/meta.html)

Not necessarily a mistake but can save people some time if we use the same property name. I spent a little while trying to understand why it wasn't working.

Message:
docs(app-vite): Update process.env caveats

`process.env.foo`, `process.env.foo.bar`, etc. would all work.
Also see https://github.com/quasarframework/quasar/commit/6463d49f70b9f27a14ae955c41a687de9460b073

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
docs(app-webpack): Update process.env caveats

`process.env.foo`, `process.env.foo.bar`, etc. would all work.
It has been like that for a very long time. It would inline the whole object but still work.
The inlining behavior was optimized in https://github.com/quasarframework/quasar/pull/8084
So, it's been working in an optimized way for almost 2 years now.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
chore(ui/uploader-core): add test-case (#14241)

* refactor(ui): Simplify logic by using unref

* fix(ui/uploader-core): Expose public fields
They were made available on the uploader scope
which is advertised as the QUploader instance itself.
This makes it feel like they are accessible on the instance itself.
So, I am exposing those fields in the component instance too.
This can be a feature or a fix depending on how you are looking at it.

* chore(ui/uploader-core): Remove completed TODO comment

* fix(ui/uploader-core): Correctly expose fields

* fix(ui/uploader-core): Use the actual instance for the slot scope

* test(ui/QUploader): Add a basic test for header slot

* Update uploader-core.js

Author: DespicableCat
Message:
feat(docs): Update publishing-to-store.md (#14354)

Use apksigner instead of jarsigner. jarsigner supports only the Signing Scheme v1, while apksigner supports multiple signing scheme versions, and it determines the scheme version to use depending on the SDK version. It is also, already included on the Android SDK.

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat(app-vite): drop filename hashes in production by default to avoid PWA update to force re-download all assets

Due to how Rollup builds the assets (through Vite), when you change any of your script source files (.js) this will also
change the hash part of (almost) ALL .js files (ex: `454d87bd` in `assets/index.454d87bd.js`). The revision number of
all assets will get changed in your service worker file and this means that when PWA updates it will re-download ALL
your assets again. What a waste of bandwidth and such a longer time to get the PWA updated!

By default, Quasar CLI configures Vite & Rollup to build all filenames **without the hash part** to avoid the
scenario above.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
fix/feat(vite-plugin): Improve and future-proof the transform checks (#14151)

* fix/feat(vite-plugin): Improve and future-proof the transform checks

* chore(vite-plugin): Add @vitejs/plugin-vue as a peer dep
We are indirectly depending on it through the resource ids. So, if a new
major version of it gets released before a new major version of Vite or
vice-versa, we might not be able to support one or the other.
Making it a peer dep will allows us to selectively support versions.

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
refactor(create-quasar): Remove old vue/ref-macros reference (#13690)

* style(create-quasar): Format shims-vue.d.ts on ts-vite

* refactor(create-quasar): Remove vue/ref-macros reference
It was used for reactivity transform macros, but that feature is still
experimental and is behind a feature flag. So, the users can add the
reference along with the configuration to avoid polluting the globals.
Also, the new name for this is "vue/macros-global", see:
https://github.com/vuejs/core/blob/bdffc143ef3aa27c347b22f19d0052194b54836e/packages/vue/ref-macros.d.ts\#L1

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
fix(app-vite&create-quasar): Utilize tsconfig-preset of app-vite and make fixes (#13689)

* fix: Utilize tsconfig-preset of app-vite
There used to be some problems with 'extends' key, mostly regarding lack of .json extension.
They are fixed, so we should utilize the tsconfig-preset, and do it correctly

* fix(app-vite): Remove 'types' key from tsconfig-preset
This is not needed as vite/client is handled in
create-quasar/templates/app/quasar-v2/ts-vite/BASE/src/shims-vue.d.ts
Also, presence of the 'types' property limits other @types/* from being
loaded/respected in some ways. We can't be sure of this behavioral
changes as it wasn't working for some time, and will be fixed in TS 4.8
So, the best way is to remove it to avoid any future problems too.

Author: disfated
Message:
fix(vite-plugin): sass variables for files with only @use statements (#13371)

* sass variables for files with only @use statements

scss-transform will fail currently for file like this:
```sass
@use 'A'
@use 'B' -- no new line here
```
gives
```
[vite] Internal server error: @use rules must be written before any other rules.
```

* Update scss-transform.js

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
chore/fix(create-quasar): Setup ESLint and fix lots of problems (#12906)

* chore(create-quasar): Setup ESLint to lint scripts and templates
It look a lot of tries to get the configuration right.
Props to @ota-meshi for support about TS: https://github.com/ota-meshi/eslint-plugin-lodash-template/issues/226
Actual fixes will be in the following commits

* fix(create-quasar): Remove unused variables

* fix(create-quasar): Comment out non-existent bubleConfig variable in UI kits

* fix(create-quasar): Remove redundant semicolons in TS files

* feat(create-quasar): Properly configure no-shadow rule for AirBnB ESLint preset

* fix(create-quasar): Convert the overlooked Mustache usage to Lodash syntax

* refactor(create-quasar): Remove underscore from filenames instead of replacing with a dot
to allow disabling files like package.json, tsconfig.json, etc. to keep tools and IDEs happy

* refactor(create-quasar): Split .eslintrc.js
The aim is to make it more flexible and manageable

* chore(create-quasar): Enable no-undef back for templates, specify the available variables

* chore(create-quasar): Bump eslint-plugin-lodash-template
No more false positive warnings 👌

* feat(create-quasar): Use 'vue/setup-compiler-macros' ESLint env

fix(app-vite): Update supported Node versions(14.19+) and make lots of fixes (#12789)

We are using private class methods which is part of ES2022:

We are also enforcing stable(even-numbered) versions of NodeJS.

Author: Dan
Message:
fix(docs): Fix type in one QScrollArea example (#12737)

The type on the opacity is incorrect because it is a Partial<CSSStyleDeclaration>. This determines that opacity is a string and not a number. This will throw an error in the template section of a typescript quasar project.

Author: Md. Shahinur Alam
Message:
fix(docs): upgrade guide on vue and vue-router installing latest version (#12364)

* vue@latest installs previous version of vue 2.6.14

$ yarn add vue@latest @quasar/extras@latest  downloads previous version of Vue.js . it downloads vue@2.6.14 and vue-router@3.5.3 resulting error.
Error comes up after refreshing node-modules from previous version.
vue & vue-router uses @next tag for their newest release.
their @latest tags are referred to previous version of vue.

reference :
 https://www.npmjs.com/package/vue  > versions
https://www.npmjs.com/package/vue-router  > versions

* line 156 also needed to change 

line 156 also needed to change  vue@latest to vue@next  vue-router@latest to vue-router@next

* Update upgrade-guide.md

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
feat/fix(Platform): Add detailed types for 'Platform.is' (fix: #12054) (#12069)

* refactor(Platform): Leave some notes about possible deprecations

* feat(ts/Platform): Add detailed types for 'is' (fix: #12054)
I didn't add 'blackberry', 'bb', 'playbook', and 'webkit' because of
possible deprecations that are mentioned in the previous commit

* feat(platform): Add detection for Chromium-based Edge
It is identified by 'edg', see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/web-platform/user-agent-guidance\#user-agent-strings

* refactor(Platform): Remove IE detection
We no longer support any version of IE, so we don't need the IE detection.

If you want to damage your brain, you can take a look at IE Mobile user agents:
https://developers.whatismybrowser.com/useragents/explore/software_name/internet-explorer-mobile/

Message:
fix(QLayout): respect fixed/non-fixed header/footer when not on iOS (fix: #11397) (#11369)

* (fix: QLayout & QHeader): containerized layout should not always sticky header and footer.
When using a containerized layout the 'H/h' and 'F/f' is not respected.
This means a containerized layout behaves different from a normal layout.

* Update QFooter.js

* Update QHeader.js

* Update layout-container.vue

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
fix(QIcon): Add check for lowercase 'm' for valid start of svg path (#11506)

* fix(QIcon): Add check for lowercase 'm' for valid start of svg path

Some icon sets work perfectly well with lowercase 'm' and when adding `M0 0z` causes a black dot in upper-left of the icon. In this case, the regex need to be `/^M|m/`

* Update QIcon.js

* Update QIcon.js

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
fix(app/icon-genie/docs): more refinement for Electron (#11163)

* fix(app): more refinement for Electron icons

Basically, the "linux-512x512.png" is not needed. The file itself should be renamed to "icon.png", which can be used by all platforms for the Tray icon (the others are needed for the embedded icons). But, we don't want to introduce any breaking changes, so if "icon.png" does not exist, we will copy "linux-512x512.png" to "icon.png". Then, in "electron-main.js" only one image file is needed for the tray icon. Additionally, we can fix "quasar-conf-file.js" to prevent the "can't stat 'icons/icon'" that only happens under linux.

* fix(icon-genie): more refinement for Electron icons

This is to support changes in App in regards to "icon.png"

* feat(app): new 'electron-handler.js'  for handling 'ipcMain' messages

The 'electron-handler.js' file is being introduced to help developers keep their separation-of-concerns out of the 'electron-main.js' file. It keeps things modular and also introduces a 'useElectronHandler()' method, which keeps it comfortable with those familiar with Vue's composition API. This method is an empty function containing commented example code.

* feat(docs): add commented example for adding Node Polyfills

* feat(docs): Give warning about installing into "dependencies" (not "devDependencies")

* feat(docs): updates for icon.png and electron-handler.js

* chore(app) electron template comments update

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
fix(app): Electron - missing icons folder in build (#11087) (#11088)

* fix(app): Electron - missing icons folder in build (#11087)

* fix(app) - additional changes to electron-main.js

The fixes include:
1. 'process.platform' is undefined if `nodeIntegration` is not true. Fall back to using `os.platform()`
2. Resolve which icon to use based on platform Electron is running on
3. Inject icon path into BrowserWindow (with previous commit this now works with both dev and build)

* revert(app): fse.copySync for electron icons

* feat(app): use CopyWebpackPlugin to copy electron icons

* chore(app): modified a comment

* Update create-chain.js

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Author: Ivan Que
Message:
feat(Notify): Hide QNotifications app from devtools (#10996)

* Hide QNotifications from devtools

Sometimes QNotification vue instance "intercepts" and become selected instance in devtools, but we need nothing to inspect there.
The same issue was in vue-toastification:  https://github.com/Maronato/vue-toastification/issues/271

* Update Notify.js

Message:
fix(ui/global-dialog): Fix Dialog's ssrAPI okCancel() => onCancel() & add onDismiss() (so that components using these functions can be tested) (#10992)

* Fix Dialog's ssrAPI okCancel() => onCancel()

* Provide an onDismiss in Dialog's ssrAPI

tests for components using the onDismiss and/or onCancel hooks no longer
fail.

Message:
fix(TouchPan): Fix for Windows OS Incorrect Mousemove Event (fix: #10721) (#10733)

* fix Windows' link Engine

* Fix Windows's Blink Engine Bug

windows OS's bug for mousemove event (Blink Engine - Chrome & Edge)
mousemove event occurs even there is no movement after mousedown

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=161464
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=721341

Author: Paolo Caleffi
Message:
feat(ts): update electron and webpack-dev-server configuration types, update ts deps (#10594)

* feat(ts): update electron and terser configuration types, update ts deps

* refactor(app/ts): cleanup and add better explanation

* refactor(app/ts): Simplify tye type imports from optional peer dependencies

We are not using any strategy like this nor have any shims for optional Vuex, but it was working nicely for a long time.

* chore(app): Add electron-builder and electron-packager as optional peer dependencies

It's for semantics and expressing the compatible versions.
I wish npm had `suggest` like `composer`(PHP), so we could provide some messages via the package manager
https://getcomposer.org/doc/04-schema.md#suggest

Co-authored-by: Yusuf Kandemir <yusuf.kandemir@outlook.com.tr>

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
feat(ts): Introduce Volar support and event types (#10839)

* feat(ts): Provide components to GlobalComponents and export props definitions as separate interfaces
These changes aims to improve Volar support and increase the reusability of types

* feat(ts): Provide event types

* refactor(ts): Move GlobalComponentConstructor to ts-helpers

* refactor(ts): Change indendation of generated code from 4 spaces to 2 spaces
Also moved it to a constant variable to improve readability

* style(ts): Add some empty lines for readability and unifying styles

* style(ts): Format the generated type file with prettier
The output is much more readable now

Author: M0jimo
Message:
Added information about Chrome devTools (#8396)

* Added information about Chrome devTools

When i was trying to debug background-hooks it took me few hours to find out why I can't see console.log in popup devTools despite the fact I was getting response from bridge.
 
I'm sure that information about `background page` devTools will help new users on the beginning.

I have doubt about placing it on this page because we are talking about environment which is described later. So, standalone page after DOM introduction would be more proper.
Images are uploaded to Google Drive (not visible here). I can provide .pptx with source screenshosts + description objects.

* (docs)BEX: Debugging BEX in Chrome

Updated links to images.

* Update build-commands.md

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Author: Ali Clark
Message:
fix #8325: Docs example axios token visibility (#8326)

* cs (czech) lang (#1874)

Hi guys, here is PR for Czech language :)

* fix bug with q-parallax when using ssr (#7196)

* Docs: Add an api instance to avoid insecure assignment of access tokens

This change adds consistency across axios boot files examples in docs,
and makes the default examples less error prone from unintentional
inclusion of Authorization tokens to 3rd party services

* Add some Markdown 'js' highlight types on code blocks, and closing brace

* Update ajax-requests.md

* Update boot-files.md

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
fix/perf(VirtualScroll): prevent re-rendering of content items when both from and to changes #8344 (#8357)

* fix/perf(VirtualScroll): prevent re-rendering of content items when both from and to changes #8344

Vue key matching algorithm works only if the array of VNodes changes on only one of the ends so we first change one end and then the other.

Only refocus on container if the active element is blurred while scrolling.

#8344

* feat(virtualScroll): adapt placeholder bg size to item size

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
feat(QSelect): improvements for QSelect #8169, #7898 (#8176) (#8213)

- open options list on autofocus when using QMenu also (make it consistent with the case of QDialog)
- improve/fix autocomplete
- fix virtualScrollItemSize when not dense
- add PG_UP, PG_DOWN, HOME and END kbd navigation in list (HOME and END if there is no text in input)
- keep input in the base control when using QDialog to prevent visual changes
- prevent duplicate clicks due to propagation from label to input

Author: Ali Clark
Message:
fix: #8166 Add an example to docs for accessing the store from router (#8182)

* Add an example for accessing the store from router

The reason for this example to exist is that Quasar defines the store
differently than Vue CLI, and there is a lot of documentation on the
internet which assumes an importable store, or suggests different
workarounds which are not as as clean as this example code

Credits to metalsadman (https://forum.quasar-framework.org/post/14454)
and vildar (https://forum.quasar-framework.org/post/16815)

* Update routing.md

Co-authored-by: Ali Clark <ali@aliclark.net>
Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Author: dsl101
Message:
Added step to Dependency Update (#7675)

* Added step to Dependency Update

Just running `yarn add --dev @quasar/app@^2.0.0` does not install the latest version, but version 2.0.0 which does not work (`quasar dev` results in a build failure error). Running `quasar upgrade -i` picked up, for me, 2.0.8 which fixed the issues.

* Update app-upgrade-guide.md

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
feat(QIntersection): new prop "root" (#7861)

Uses Intersection directive "root" config. Using the "root" property allows an ancestor to be defined. Currently, none of the QIntersection/Intersection examples work on Codepen. I have added one for QIntersection that will work because it uses it's immediate parent as root.

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
feat(QIntersection): new prop "root" (#7861)

Uses Intersection directive "root" config. Using the "root" property allows an ancestor to be defined. Currently, none of the QIntersection/Intersection examples work on Codepen. I have added one for QIntersection that will work because it uses it's immediate parent as root.

Author: r4wand
Message:
kur-ckb.js lang bug fix (#7614)

* first day of the week fix

i made a silly mistake of counting the days from right to left but .split() function separates it from left to right. based on that first day of the week should be index 6/Saturday(شەممە) but I previously set it as index 0 which would make it Friday(هەینی). this is a fix for my mistake.

* set rtl to true

fix(docs): Fix various grammar mistakes (#7564)

* fix(docs): Reword phrase to make it clearer

Changed `The overlay mode makes the drawer not to occupy space` to `The overlay mode prevents the drawer from occupying space`

* fix(docs): Fix grammar mistakes

Changed `Does not auto-closes when app's route changes` to `Prevents drawer from auto-closing when app's route changes`
Changed second-person descriptions to third person (e.g. `Disable` to `Disables`, `Force` to `Forces`

* fix(docs): Added closing quote

Changed `:grid="$q.screen.lt.md` to `:grid="$q.screen.lt.md"`

Message:
[Feature] QUploaderBase.js adding the capture param (#7249)

To force the Recorder Util this is needed.
eg. 
 :accept="'video/*'"
 :capture="'user'"
forces on Mobile a nice CamRecorder (was boolean, now needs a string)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/capture

Author: bias-santa
Message:
docs(fix): Typo in row column wrapping (#7094)

* Fixes typo and changes an example

I tried to come up with a new example, that better demonstrates "column-wrapping". I found the second example confusing for new readers since it also requires knowledge about breakpoints, and to see the effect, you need to resize the browser window. Or you may not even know which rule is applied on the screen you are viewing the docs. So I tried to come up with something more intuitive :) Also fixed a typo.

* Update RowColumnWrapping.vue

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Fixes the cascade close of menus and problems with refocusing of elements.

Ref #5888 - the initial markup will be without the negative tabindex, but after the first click there will be tabindex.

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat(QIcon): Enhance format for svg form (can add multiple paths, each with its own style and svg transform) #6976

New format:

path@@style_attr@@transform_attr&&path@@style_attr@@transform_attr&&...|viewBox

 - A path is defined by: path@@style_attr@@transform_attr
     * style_attr is optional
     * transform_attr is optional
     * if no style_attr but you have a transform, still use the separator between path and style_attr
       (path@@@@transform_attr)
 - Supports multiple paths, separated by "&&"
 - viewBox is optional
 - Backward compatibility with the old format (path|viewBox)

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
fix(QDrawer): Initialize lastDesktopState to prevent different behavior when started above or below breakpoint #6905 (#6909)

The lastDesktopState should be:
- the current state when it changes from above to below breakpoint (in all cases)
- only when started below breakpoint then it should be true if showIfAbove and false else

Reproduction:
- start layout-keep-state-above below bp
- resize to above bp => right drawer shows
- resize to below bp => right drawer hides

- start layout-keep-state-above above bp
- resize to below bp => right stays hidden (lastDesktopState is set to false)
- resize to above bp => right stays hidden (lastDesktopState is false)

Message:
fix(docs) Try to fix Tab to search with title attr (#6726)

MDN says that it's required and it must match the xml description file. It's kinda weird because I didn't need it for testing, but since it doesn't work on `quasar.dev` on any machine I tried, let's try if this fixes it.

see [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/OpenSearch) for more details

Author: Stefan van Herwijnen
Message:
docs: fix uploader nodejs example (#6160)

I don't know why it happens, but if you place the nodejs server behind a reverse proxy and send a response outside of `form.parse()`, the upload fails without any error or warnings for larger files. It probably has something to do with buffering of the request, not sure why.
I figured I'd make a PR so no one else runs into the problem with this example.

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
Refactor all components using target/scroll-target to use the same interface #5906 (#5421)

* Refactor all components using target/scroll-target to use the same interface

- target accepts (in QMenu, QPopupProxy, QTooltip):
  - true => auto find target based on first parent (starting from parentEl) without .q-anchor--skip class
  - false => no anchor
  - Vue instance => uses $el of that instance
  - CSS selector or DOM element => that element

- scroll-target accepts (in QInfiniteScroll, QMenu, QScrollObserver, QParalax, QPullToRefresh, QTooltip, QVirtualScroll)
  - null or void 0 => auto detect using getScrollTarget
  - Vue instance => uses $el of that instance
  - CSS selector or DOM element => that element
  - in the end, if the scroll target is document, document.body, document.scrollingElement or document.documentElement, window is selected as scroll target
  

close #5051

* Update scroll-observer.md

* Update scroll.js

* Update QInfiniteScroll.js

* Update QInfiniteScroll.json

* Update QMenu.js

* Update QMenu.js

* Update QMenu.json

* Update QParallax.js

* Update QParallax.json

* Update QPullToRefresh.js

* Update QPullToRefresh.json

* Update QScrollObserver.js

* Update QScrollObserver.json

* Update QTooltip.js

* Update QTooltip.json

* Update QVirtualScroll.js

* Update QVirtualScroll.json

* Update anchor.js

Co-authored-by: Razvan Stoenescu <razvan.stoenescu@gmail.com>

Message:
Update QUploaderBase.js (#6116)

maxTotalSize applied incorrectly.
1. It is possible to exceed maxTotalSize if uploading files one by one: line 269 allows it, starting size from 0 when adding files in queue, not all in bunch. 
2. Line 274: we always lose the last file not exceeding maxTotalSize when loading files in bunch.

Author: gregveres
Message:
new instructions for windows users (#5973)

The instructions for windows users were not correct given the state of things in December 2019. In addition to the software listed on this page to install, I had to install the JDK separately and gradle separately. And Cordova has moved on and now requires android-28 SDK to be installed or it wont work. 

I have followed the new instructions in this PR and tested that it worked properly. I pass the cordova requirements check.

Author: webnoob
Message:
feat(bex): Add documentation for bex mode #76 (#5812)

* fix(bex): Devtools bex can't communicate with content script.

* fix(bex): Entry files should be in .quasar directory

Moved all `src-bex/core` files into `.quasar/bex`

* fix(bex): File names not in standard Quasar kebab-case format

Breaking Change: 

1. Go through all files in src-bex/[js/css] and rename to kebab case.
2. Delete core folder if it exists
3. Go into manifest.json and rename any files referenced to kebab-case.

* fix(bex): Background script not able to communicate with all BEX bridges

The background script can now communicate with all BEX content script and app bridges.

* fix(bex): Normalise file / function usage. Remove bloat. Refactor.

BREAKING CHANGES:

1. Remove `global-background-hooks.js` from `src-bex/js`
2. Rename `activated-*.js" to remove the activated.
3. Go into `content-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge)`.
4. Go into `background-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge, 
 allActiveConnections)`

`allActiveConnections` has been added to allow the user to communicate with a specific connection if they so wish. This means you can use the background events to ONLY communicate with the dev tools panel or popup or options etc.

Comments have also been updated against the core files to reflect new file structure / names.

* fix(bex): Code refactor

Loop didn't need to use Object.keys()

* chore(bex): Remove merge files which got left behind.

* feat(bex): Allow communication between the web page and the BEX.

This will allow a communication layer for the webpage and the bex content script.

* fix(bex): Fix paths on build #76

New file structure didn't alter the production build.

* fix(bex): Fix regression in content script communication #76

* fix(bex): Popup comms: Tab not defined just because chrome.tabs is.

* feat(bex): Add documentation for bex mode #76

Message:
fix(QTree): Account for disabled/untickable nodes to determine the next tick status when current is indeterminate #5769 (#5776)

* chore(QTree): Improve boolean checks

* fix(QTree): Account for disabled/untickable nodes when computing indeterminate tick status #5769

If an indeterminate parent has a ticked disabled child the parent can never change to ticked.
If an indeterminate parent has an unticked disabled child the parent can never change to unticked.

Author: webnoob
Message:
fix(bex): Popup comms: Tab not defined just because chrome.tabs is. (#5581)

* fix(bex): Devtools bex can't communicate with content script.

* fix(bex): Entry files should be in .quasar directory

Moved all `src-bex/core` files into `.quasar/bex`

* fix(bex): File names not in standard Quasar kebab-case format

Breaking Change: 

1. Go through all files in src-bex/[js/css] and rename to kebab case.
2. Delete core folder if it exists
3. Go into manifest.json and rename any files referenced to kebab-case.

* fix(bex): Background script not able to communicate with all BEX bridges

The background script can now communicate with all BEX content script and app bridges.

* fix(bex): Normalise file / function usage. Remove bloat. Refactor.

BREAKING CHANGES:

1. Remove `global-background-hooks.js` from `src-bex/js`
2. Rename `activated-*.js" to remove the activated.
3. Go into `content-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge)`.
4. Go into `background-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge, 
 allActiveConnections)`

`allActiveConnections` has been added to allow the user to communicate with a specific connection if they so wish. This means you can use the background events to ONLY communicate with the dev tools panel or popup or options etc.

Comments have also been updated against the core files to reflect new file structure / names.

* fix(bex): Code refactor

Loop didn't need to use Object.keys()

* chore(bex): Remove merge files which got left behind.

* feat(bex): Allow communication between the web page and the BEX.

This will allow a communication layer for the webpage and the bex content script.

* fix(bex): Fix paths on build #76

New file structure didn't alter the production build.

* fix(bex): Fix regression in content script communication #76

* fix(bex): Popup comms: Tab not defined just because chrome.tabs is.

Message:
fix(bex): Fix regression in content script communication #76 (#5570)

* fix(bex): Devtools bex can't communicate with content script.

* fix(bex): Entry files should be in .quasar directory

Moved all `src-bex/core` files into `.quasar/bex`

* fix(bex): File names not in standard Quasar kebab-case format

Breaking Change: 

1. Go through all files in src-bex/[js/css] and rename to kebab case.
2. Delete core folder if it exists
3. Go into manifest.json and rename any files referenced to kebab-case.

* fix(bex): Background script not able to communicate with all BEX bridges

The background script can now communicate with all BEX content script and app bridges.

* fix(bex): Normalise file / function usage. Remove bloat. Refactor.

BREAKING CHANGES:

1. Remove `global-background-hooks.js` from `src-bex/js`
2. Rename `activated-*.js" to remove the activated.
3. Go into `content-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge)`.
4. Go into `background-hooks.js` and change the function definition params to `(bridge, 
 allActiveConnections)`

`allActiveConnections` has been added to allow the user to communicate with a specific connection if they so wish. This means you can use the background events to ONLY communicate with the dev tools panel or popup or options etc.

Comments have also been updated against the core files to reflect new file structure / names.

* fix(bex): Code refactor

Loop didn't need to use Object.keys()

* chore(bex): Remove merge files which got left behind.

* feat(bex): Allow communication between the web page and the BEX.

This will allow a communication layer for the webpage and the bex content script.

New file structure didn't alter the production build.

Author: dsl101
Message:
Clarify @input event (#5477)

* Clarify @input event

This caused me some confusion, and now I understand it I'm updating the description to match my current understanding:

Removed reference to panel name, as this doesn't make sense for QStepper or QCarousel.
Clarify that @input event only fires when the component changes the model, not when the model is changed externally.
Note there are other references to 'panel' in other parts of this doc, so perhaps all should be changed to 'panel / slide / step'? Happy to do that if it's useful.

* Update panel-parent.json

Author: Luca Ban
Message:
fix(docs): adjust explanation of columns' name 🖍 (#4693)

* adjust explanation of columns' id 🖍

I had a really hard time understanding the difference between `row-key` which is often set to `name` in the examples here, and the `name` field on the `columns` object.

I know in retrospect it's a really simple difference: columns each have a `name` and rows each have an id or something to be set with `row-key`.

But I believe that the `row-key` has nothing to do with the columns `name` field if I'm not mistaken. So writing "used by row-key" at the columns `name` only further confused me. 😅

* Update table.md

Author: Jeff Galbraith
Message:
fix(docApi): filter gives false-positive for "props" when nothing found (#5292)

* fix(docs): Fixing markdown tables to fit content

Default width of 100% makes tables with 2 columns look horrible. A better compomise if to use "width: fit-content" so the table is only as wide as the data. "max-width: 100%" is used to keep current width should data make the rows greater than 100%. This is especially needed for the "Upgrade guide".

* feat(docs): Fixing hydration issues

* Update(docs): Update docs with devServer -> watchOptions #4244

Message:
fix(focus related): QBtn, QMenu, ClickOutside, QSelect, Ripple (#5119)

* fix(focus related): QBtn, QMenu, ClickOutside, QSelect, Ripple

- QBtn: simplify logic and prevent keyboard clicks with different sources on keydown and keyup
- ClickOutside: prevent hiding a dialog backdrop, listen on click to be able to prevent it
- QMenu: on hide only refocus if closed from code, ESC plugin or not from a mouse/touch event on clickOutside
- QSelect: fix duplicate ref 'target', fix focusing
- Ripple: add configuration for keyCodes that should trigger it

* Update QBtn.js

* Update QBtn.js

Author: webnoob
Message:
Mode browser extension fix: #76 (#5193)

* feat (BEX) - Add browser extension mode to Quasar.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Lots of changes to get in page extensions working.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Todo message to look into statics.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Update template for init script.

* feat (BEX [WIP])
- Further init template changes.
- Extension to now use different template id for mounting so it can be used on a quasar (other vue) website.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Remove key from manifest template (FF doesn't like it).

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Remove comments from init file.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - More work on the build system. Currently builds for FF, Chrome and can dev on Chrome 100% and FF 50%.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Big refactor. Core Quasar will now only be responsible for in browser apps. Not overlay bex's. This has moved to an AE QBexOverlay.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Big refactor. Added a communication bridge between Quasar and the chrome extension runtime.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Fix race condition with hook initialization.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Refactor to sort true 2 way front end backend communication.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Fix build path.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Change location of browserAction hook so it can be removed / changed by the user.

* feat (BEX [WIP]) - Add a way of attaching events before the BEX is active (to allow the BEX to be activated)

* Big re-work to allow client -> contentScript -> background communication to work effectively in Chrome and FireFox.

* Tweak some comments.
Alter manifest script paths on compile complete so they match the built version of the code.

* Copy BEX files on dev / build.
Updated comments in code.
Removed hooks.js - It's not required with how the comm bridge is now working.

* Add option so minimisation doesn't happen if the user sets.

* Fix logic on previous fix. Pesky !

* Change minify option name.

* Change the bridge to work with promises.
Add a feature so when a payload is an array and larger then 32MB, it will be split into chunks so the data can be transferred to the client then the promise resolved.

* Fix spacing

* fix (bex): Messages getting mixed up when using the same event. i.e Asking for 2 different sets of data from the DB.

* fix (bex): Re-work out files are copied to output dirs as registering 2 webpackcopy plugins is nasty and doesn't work well with each other.

* fix (bex): Re-work how index.html excludes the bex entry bundles.

* fix (bex): Re-work how index.html excludes the bex entry bundles.

* fix (bex): Isolate connections per tab so communications meant for the content script don't get sent to all content scripts.

* feat (bex): Split out the background scripts into a new compilation thread. Allow configurable output paths.

* fix (bex): Background build scripts need watching for changes.

* fix (bex): Don't try and send messages when the port is disconnected.

* fix (bex): Linting issues. Write dev files replacement.

* fix (bex): Remove custom q-app tag for bex.

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
feat(QSelect): Emit Vue popup-show/popup-hide events, fix inconsistency on blur (#5105)

* feat(QSelect): Emit Vue popup-show/popup-hide events, fix inconsistency on blur

- stop propagation of native popup-show/hide from inside another popup
- QSelect - fix inconsistency where:
-- if you open list of options and click outside the QSelect stays focused
-- if it is single selection and you select an option the QSelect is unfocused
-- if it is multiple selection and you clicked on an option and then click outside the QSelect is unfocused
- fix field focus lose for kbd navigation on click on an option in list

* Don't expose popup-show/hide as public API for QField

Author: Yusuf Kandemir
Message:
Fixed some of sequential Loading's were not showing

When hide is called plugin will enter the hiding state. Hiding state disappears when the leave transition is finished just as before. If `show()` is called when the loading is hiding, the loading will be force hidden, then the new loading will be shown.

Author: nothingismagick
Message:
fix(app): generator improperly using fs.existsSync (#4951)

* fix(app): generator improperly using fs.existsSync

I stumbled across this while preparing the `tauri` merge. The issue is that `fs.existsSync` is there to detect if a FILE exists, not a folder. This is an edge case that shouldn't ever occur, except for cases where the operator makes a mistake or an app-extension / something else is being a bad actor. This PR remediates the improper call and catches this wild edge case, deleting the file that has no reason for existence and then safely creating the folder. 

Note: if .quasar is a folder, nothing changes from current behavior.

* Update generator.js

update(flex playground): update color scheme (#4868)

* Revert "initial json api for QSelect"

This reverts commit 687013f5efcf91cc2e409196f627f1c32867b3b0.

* feat(docs): QChip

* feat(docs): QImg

* fix(docs): Fixing markdown tables to fit content

Default width of 100% makes tables with 2 columns look horrible. A better compomise if to use "width: fit-content" so the table is only as wide as the data. "max-width: 100%" is used to keep current width should data make the rows greater than 100%. This is especially needed for the "Upgrade guide".

* feat(docs): Fixing hydration issues

Author: Zir
Message:
Add example on how to use inline (data uri) images/icons

Add a more advanced example of using external icons/images generated through code rather than by importing from file. by taking advantage of 'data uri' syntax. SVG icon looks can be modified by using props in computed property or even css classes in this way.

Please see working demo I've made:

https://jsfiddle.net/Zireael/7vzxc926/27/

Few word fixes (#4592)

* Removed extra word

* Re-arranged some words

I just felt that the word does not resonate with the day to day meaning of its contextual usage.
Some experts believed that the word "existent" is more common in religious and philosophical writings.

Author: 2x2xplz
Message:
add `publish` key to cfg.electron.builder

If the user is building for electron and using electron-builder, this is where we check whether the user specified the new `--publish` or `-P` flag. It is not read or used anywhere else, so it is totally ignored if building SPA, Cordova, etc., and is also ignored if using electron-packager. If found, its value is passed directly to the electron-builder API. If this value is not a valid option (see https://www.electron.build/configuration/publish), or if the user has not also created a valid publish configuration, then electron-builder will raise an error.

Author: 2x2xplz
Message:
logs the electron config if CLI 'debug' is active

If user specifies `--debug` or `-d` in the CLI, and is packaging an electron executable, then the config object passed to electron-builder or electron-packager will be logged to the screen.

Author: 2x2xplz
Message:
add --publish option to quasar-build

electron-builder has options to publish the new packaged executables to Github, Bintray, S3, etc. but this must be specifically triggered. Users must configure the publishing options, however just the presence of a properly-configured option set will not actually do anything unless the `electron-build` CLI command has a `--publish` flag. Our case is more complicated because we are triggering the build programmatically (https://www.electron.build/api/electron-builder), not via the CLI. So we need a `publish` key in the options that we pass to the API, that is *outside* the `config` options.

This change adds a `--publish` (or `-P`) flag that passes its value to electron-builder. It does nothing if not in electron mode or not using electron-builder.

Author: 2x2xplz
Message: add `publish` option to ctx

Message:
replace references to 'appPaths' to 'appPath' (#4375)

* cs (czech) lang (#1874)

Hi guys, here is PR for Czech language :)

* references to `appPaths` changed to `appPath`

There is no variable named `appPaths`, only `appPath`  The incorrectly-named variable causes an error when running `quasar inspect -m electron -c build` : " ReferenceError: appPaths is not defined"

Default width of 100% makes tables with 2 columns look horrible. A better compomise if to use "width: fit-content" so the table is only as wide as the data. Author: nothingismagick
Message:
Add "Greater Good" Affirmation Link (#4105)

There is a rather lengthy discussion going on at the sfosc repo about what sustainable open source is, and I think that showing our users that we really are invested in open source is a good thing to do. Here is some background information.

https://github.com/sfosc/sfosc/issues/65
https://github.com/good-labs/greater-good-affirmation

Author: 2x2xplz
Message:
added a `thumb-always` option (issue #4002) (#4008)

* added a `thumb-always` option

The default behavior is to hide the slider thumb (the circular marker) whenever a label is present. This can be confusing when the `label-always` option is active, because the thumb is never visible, and it doesn't give the user the expected visual cue that sliding is possible. Even if the user knows, the lack of a thumb makes the visual target (for the mouse, or finger) seem much smaller. Having a `thumb-always` option will keep the thumb visible even with a label, if the developer wants it.

* Update QSlider.json

* Update slider-utils.js

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
fix(QSelect): Multiple fixes & improvements

* hide-selected --> does not take current selected value (regardless
  if multiple selection is enabled or not
* QField --> take into account QSelect case to determine if label
  floats above: inputValue length if hide-selected
* Reworked updating the inputValue & calling filter (also avoids
  case when filter() was called multiple times)
* Target keydown even closes menu when hitting TAB key
* Improve speed of case detection in target keydown
* Do not close menu on ENTER key equivalent when on mobile with Dialog
* Avoid calling filter if not focused
* When multiple selection, do not reset inputValue on menu selection
  (mouse or ENTER key on an option) because user might want to also
  select more options from the filtered menu
* Avoid double-calling __onControlFocusout() method when QMenu hides
* Avoid uselessly calling __onControlFocusin() method when QMenu gets
  shown
* Improve setting inputValue method throughout QSelect

feat(security:SSR) Add headers

This PR adds optional security headers to the src-sst/index.js

importantly adds several critical ones to the docs.

Author: 2x2xplz
Message:
Restore "hide-upload-button" option from 0.17

When using the upload component within a larger form, it may be desirable to disallow file uploading directly from the component. 0.17 had this option. Currently 1.0-beta requires the entire header to be overwritten via scoped slot to hide the `upload` button.

This update also hides the `add` button when the `multiple` option is not enabled and a file has already been selected.

Author: Emmanuel Hadoux
Message:
Add a space before the colon and addition typos (#3847)

As per French typography, a space is required before all two-signed punctuation (colon, semi-colon, exclamation and question marks). Everything else looks good, except 'Tous' for allRows that can be 'Tous', 'Tout' or 'Toutes' depending on the context. That said, if it indeed refers to the rows, it should be 'Toutes' if it means 'all the rows' or 'Tout' if it means everything. I don't want to make the change for that yet.
I also hope the œ in nœud is not a problem. If it is, oe (o followed by e) is equally as understandable.

Author: Andrei
Message:
index.d.ts Promise type (#3771)

**Steps to reproduce this bug**

```bash
$ vue create my-app
$ cd my-app
$ vue add quasar@beta
$ vue invoke quasar
$ yarn serve
```

```javascript
ERROR in /node_modules/quasar/dist/types/index.d.ts
751:17 Generic type 'Promise' requires 1 type argument(s).
    749 | export interface QForm extends Vue {
    750 |     autofocus? : Boolean
  > 751 |     validate(): Promise
        |                 ^
    752 |     resetValidation(): void
    753 |     focus(): void
    754 | }
Version: typescript 3.4.1
```

**Fix:**

quasar/src/components/form/QForm.json

```json
"type": "Promise",
```

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
feat(quasar): Refactoring popup related to improve navigation (#3712)

* fix(quasar): Enhance QField focusing logic (QInput and QSelect)

* feat(quasar): Refactoring popup related to improve navigation

- QDialog
  - add autoClose prop (similar to QMenu) using VClosePopup to close
  - use ClickOutside - catch focus below dialog
  - refocus dialog on shake
  - emit bubbling popup-show/hide events - used for QField
- ClickOutside
  - blur when document refocuses outside popup
  - enhance detection
  - emit escape by default (allows dialog closing in the right order)
- QField
  - keep focus when there are popups opened from inside
- QMenu
  - add noRefocus prop (similar to QDialog) and implement refocus on close
  - add observeAnchor and noFocus props (for QSelect like use)
  - focus QMenu on open (similar to QDialog)
  - use VCloseDialog to implement autoClose
  - do not prevent opening and closing event
  - emit bubbling popup-show/hide events - used for QField
  - adjust position engine to use bottom/right when required to allow auto-sizing
- VClosePopup
  - adjustments to make it also work on the container of QMenu or QDialog
- QPopupProxy, anchor mixin, moddel toggle mixin
  - don't react to prevented events
- anchor mixin
  - prevent context menu (prevention removed from QMenu) and fix text selection

Message:
fix(docs): Fixing markdown tables to fit content (#3373)

Default width of 100% makes tables with 2 columns look horrible. A better compomise if to use "width: fit-content" so the table is only as wide as the data. "max-width: 100%" is used to keep current width should data make the rows greater than 100%. This is especially needed for the "Upgrade guide".

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
[v1] QDate + QTime: enhance model string parsing (#3120)

QDate:
- work with negative year (more than -13 - see title)
- formats positive years < 1000 to 4 chars so it works with mask
- parses incomplete date strings (2018/03, 2018/03/8, 18/3/5)
- wraps months > 12
- invalidates wrong days (> last day in month)
- if model is valid but missing digits it is updated on close (2018/03/3 => 2018/03/03)

QTime:
- selects the first view that is not filled (12: => minutes)
- fixes computedFormat24h (was sometimes string sometimes number)
- does not update on invalid model
- if model is valid but missing digits it is updated on close (12/03/3 => 12/03/03)
- wraps around hour, minute, second

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
fix(quasar): QSelect - make .q-select__input color obey field color; fix lefover q-popup--skip; fix timing for filter (#3177)

- q-popup--skip - added test in dev
- filter timing:
  - this.menu is set in the same tick when fn() is called
  - in the next tick the options are updated, but QSelect has for one tick the old ones with menu open (reproduced by filtering to see no option and then clearing filter - it must not have no-option slot)

Author: olegvakulenko
Message:
Update card.ios.styl (#2762)

If buttons in action area of the card not fitted in one line, they placed on new line and before this button add left margin. This behavior see on first example on Card page on mobile view (button "RESERVE"). This change removes left margin and add right margin on not last button.

Author: olegvakulenko
Message:
Update card.mat.styl (#2761)

If buttons in action area of the card not fitted in one line, they placed on new line and before this button add left margin. This behavior see on first example on Card page on mobile view (button "RESERVED"). This change removes left margin and add right margin on not last button.

Author: James Harrington
Message:
Allow password to be shown by default (#2591)

* Allow password to be shown by default

Usage `<q-input v-model="user.password" type="password" :show-password="true" float-label="Password" />`
this change will allow a password field and show/hide icon to be visible by default.

This might be good for an admin panel where you have to make a user account and send that user the credentials.

* Update QInput.js

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
QPopupEdit, QPopover, QModal: fixes related to 'escape-key' (#2578)

* QPopupEdit, QPopover, QModal: fixes related to 'escape-key'

- QModal: emit 'escape-key' before hide
- QPopover:  emit 'escape-key' before hide
- QPopupEdit:
  - fix focus for textarea (querySelector on multiple selectors returns the first one in dom that matches)
  - listen for 'escape-key' and emit cancel

QPopupEdit - expected behavior:
- if it has buttons:
 - cancel btn => cancel and close
 - set btn => if verify than change and close else do not close
 - ESC key => if persistent then do not close else cancel and close
 - ENTER key => if verify then change and close else do not close
 - click outside => if persistent then do not close else if verify then change and close else cancel and close

- if it has no buttons
 - ESC key => if persistent then do not close else cancel and close
 - ENTER key => if verify then change and close else cancel and close
 - click outside=> if persistent then do not close else if verify then change and close else cancel and close

close #2577

* QPopover: allow dismiss by ESC key even if persistent

Message:
Brazilian portuguese localization updates. (#2351)

With the new grid layout for data tables, the current pt-br localization is not using the correct term for registers. As translated before this PR, it reffered to registers as lines.

I've also made some small changes to some capitalized letters, which were not following the correct pattern.

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
QDatetime: format when type is date and formatModel is string (#2231)

The emitted value will be formatted as "YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss", with time discarded, when:
- type="date"
- format-model="string"
- value matches /^\d{4}[^\d]\d{2}[^\d]\d{2}/

fixes #2229

Author: Popescu Dan
Message:
Improve keyboard navigation (#1936)

- QModal
  - fix not emmiting dismiss on ESC
  - focus after show
  - add back noRefocus
- QPopover
  - focus after show
  - refocus after hide (noRefocus prop)
  - allow toggle by keyboard ENTER
- QDialog
  - fix button focus
  - find button by class name (q-btn)
  - add back noRefocus
- QFab - refocus after hide
- QTab / QRouteTab
  - focus with keyboard
  - allow select with keyboard ENTER
- QColor and QDatetime
  - fix tabindex lost on close
  - fix popup not closing on blur
- QColorPicker
  - fix incorrect tabindex on disable
  - allow to select saturation on click on mobile (was working only on drag)
- QDatetimePicker.mat - allow keyboard adjustment of all values
- QActionsheet
  - select option with ENTER/SPACE, navigation with TAB
  - trigger selection on keyup to avoid click on original button
- QAutocomplete - use QPopup with noFocus
- QKnob, QSlider, QRange - keyboard updating (UP|RIGHT +, DOWN|LEFT -, CTRL+... 10*)
- QSelect
  - remove autofocusFilter - always select filter if present
  - move keyboard navigation on QPopover
  - delay popover.reposition on filter to allow resize
- v-back-to-top, v-close-overlay, v-go-back, v-ripple - trigger by keyboard ENTER
- QInput - set model on ENTER

Author: olegvakulenko
Message:
Update QPagination.js (#1789)

I propose this change, because:
1. when number of pages equals or less than 9 (first example), button rendered very small on phone and usage in that case very uncomfortable;
2. in case of number greater than 9 (more often), button min width already been 2;
3. in rare case, when number greater than 99, this style setting is redundant.
Or even better solution to move this to CSS.
Thanks!

Author: Martin Beaudet
Message:
fix 1397 - Cannot unselect a node in QTree (#1398)

* Storing an empty string and getting it back produce a bad behavior.
There was a test for considering the value only if it contains at least 10 chars, but 9 is the correct number. As each key plus separator '"__q_strn|".length' contains 9 chars not 10. So getting a value from "__q_strn|" was returning "__q_strn|" instead of "".

* Should not it be validator instead of validation in QTree for tickStragegy props ?

* Webstorage plugin (localStorage was load as sessionStorage)

* Allow unselecting a node in QTree

* Update QTree.js

Author: Martin Beaudet
Message:
Webstorage plugin (localStorage was load as sessionStorage) (#1326)

* Storing an empty string and getting it back produce a bad behavior.
There was a test for considering the value only if it contains at least 10 chars, but 9 is the correct number. As each key plus separator '"__q_strn|".length' contains 9 chars not 10. So getting a value from "__q_strn|" was returning "__q_strn|" instead of "".

* Should not it be validator instead of validation in QTree for tickStragegy props ?

* Webstorage plugin (localStorage was load as sessionStorage)

Author: Martin Beaudet
Message:
QTree - tickStrategy validator instead of validation ? (#1312)

* Storing an empty string and getting it back produce a bad behavior.
There was a test for considering the value only if it contains at least 10 chars, but 9 is the correct number. As each key plus separator '"__q_strn|".length' contains 9 chars not 10. So getting a value from "__q_strn|" was returning "__q_strn|" instead of "".

* Should not it be validator instead of validation in QTree for tickStragegy props ?

Author: Sumurai8
Message:
#1063 cancel debounce qtabs (#1067)

* #1063 Cancel redraw when component is destroyed

This commit adds a cancel method to the debounce function, allowing to
cancel a previously debounced function to not be executed. The debounced
functions in QTabs are now cancelled just before the component is
destroyed.

* Fixing linter error; Fixed double timeout causing same error

Fixed linter error in debounce.js. Fixed the timeout used to 'let
browser drawing stabilize' by removing it, as the functions are already
debounced and thus delayed. Alternative fix: Save timer id and manually
cancel it in the destroy function.

Author: David Hayes
Message:
Fix linear gradient for DateTime component on iOS (#833)

On iOS, the linear-gradient on the .q-datetime-mask element indicated that the middle of the gradient use a color stop of "transparent 50%", using transparent in a linear-gradient is not support on mobile Safari. See https://stackoverflow.com/a/27118826

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
refactor: Improve events emitted by QUploader

| Vue Event | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `@add(files)` | Triggered when file is picked for upload |
| `@remove(file)` | Triggered when file is removed from upload queue |
| `@upload(file, xhr)` | Triggered individually for each file that has just been uploaded |
| `@fail(file, xhr)` | Triggered individually for each file that has encountered error while
uploading |
| `@start` | Triggered when upload has started |
| `@finish` | Triggered when upload of file(s) has ended (with success or failure) |

Message:
fix: Fixes for Popovers and Modal

* Popovers are created but not shown when on a Modal
* Popovers on a Modal do not close when scrolling the Modal
* Utils.dom.getScrollTarget() now looks for "scroll" CSS class
* Modal "content-css" prop can now be String too
* Callback is executed when opening/closing already opened/closed Modal with callback
* Fixed HMR issues when updating Modal
* Select type now defaults to "list" instead of requiring "type" prop

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
refactor: Popover - simplify logic; no anchor-ref necessary anymore

Just place <quasar-popover> inside the anchor DOM element or component.
Popover won't inherit CSS from anchor since it will be injected as a
direct child of document body.

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat: #64 Improve Infinite Scroll control

Infinite Scroll methods:
* loadMore() --> calls handler (index, function (stopLoading) {...} )
* reset() --> resets index; does not starts it or stop it
* stop() --> stops working
* resume() --> starts it and triggers a loadMore() only if user has scrolled past the offset point

Infinite Scroll props:
* handler
* inline --> when using inside an overflowed container
* offset --> (Optional) Number representing offset in pixels of content height left to read that should trigger a loadMore(); default value: 1 container height.
* working --> Boolean which specifies Infinite Scroll state; should IS work or not

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat: #54 Polished Infinite Scroll

Infinite Scroll component now has two more methods:
* reset ([Boolean])
     --> resets index and loads more content
     --> if parameter is "true" it does not load more content
* loadMore ()
     --> triggers a "refresh" calling your "handler"

Author: Razvan Stoenescu
Message:
feat: #31 Polished Toast

* Only display one at a time. As a result there's no need anymore to
  show the "delete all" icon on the right. More screen real estate
  for the message itself.
* If triggering a Toast while another is being displayed then the first
  Toast is first slided out of view, then the new one slided into view.
  As a result the App's screen real estate is not filled with Toasts on
  top of your Layouts/Pages.
* Animation:
  * in: slide-up then fade in the contents
  * out: slide-down
* One color only (a neutral dark grey one); user can get confused by
  the multitude of colors popping up from the bottom of the screen and
  some colors may not get along with the design of an App (like positive
  Toast with the default primary color)
* No timeout. Just a default timeout of 3s. Toasts should inform user
  with a quick message and optionally an action like "Undo". Toasts
  should not control the flow or your app. For more complex cases a
  Dialog should be used instead.

+ Swap Theme on the fly API

screens
+ Drawer opener should be placed behind the Toolbars (header & footer)
